"(Can&#039;t Live Without Your) Love and Affection" is a single by Nelson. It was released in 1990 on Geffen Records and backed with "Will You Love Me". The song was based on a crush on Cindy Crawford.

The production on the single and its B-side, "Will You Love Me", was done by David Thoener and Marc Tanner. It also appears as the first track on Nelson&#039;s album, After the Rain.

It became a number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100 in 1990, the duo&#039;s only chart-topper.

It was also critiqued on Season 2 of Beavis and Butthead where the boys thought they were "chicks who look like guys" and thought they were Ozzy Osbourne&#039;s granddaughters or Elvis&#039;s children.

The Nelson brothers spent two years learning how to write songs and in the process, met LA artist/producer Marc Tanner who became their mentor. Together, Marc, Gunnar, and Matthew brainstormed and wrote what would become the triple-platinum After The Rain album in 1990 after being signed to [Geffen Records] in 1989. 

Their singles, "(I Can&#039;t Live Without Your) Love and Affection", "After the Rain", "More Than Ever", "Only Time Will Tell" and "(You Got Me) All Shook Up," all held positions on Billboard&#039;s top 40 with "Love and Affection" reaching #1 in September of 1990 after receiving airplay on [MTV] where they also had #1 videos.
